title: Thunderbird forces as active/focused window and using another program
content:
This issue started as soon as Thunderbird updated to 115.3.1 (64 bits).

I was in another window, a full screen (borderless) game, and as soon as I received a new e-mail, Thunderbird minimized the game to focus on the Thunderbird window. I tested this sending a e-mail to myself and the same thing happened but also tested this while writing this message and this time the focus did not change to Thunderbird.

So as a workaround I am having to close Thunderbird as I am playing games.
creator: Rafcor

title: ver 115.2.2 (32-bit) does not display email account under account header
content:
My thunderbird just upgraded to 115.2.2 (32-bit) - my windows is 64-bit - but when I create a new folder:

(1) It does not copy the headers from the other folders, as it used to, which is not the end of the world -- I'm just forced to re-create them (which has never happened before in all the years of upgrades) (2) Under the Account header, it should show the email a/c I used to send that email (or the a/c that received that email) but instead it just displays "Local Folders"

I need to know which email it was sent from/received at. How do I get it to display the email account and not "local folders"? Thank you!
creator: valarcher

title: Inquiry About Multi-Account Support for Gmail and Custom Domain Email Providers
content:
Dear Mozilla Support Team,

I hope this email finds you well. I am currently using Mozilla's email client and have some questions regarding its capabilities for multi-account support.

1. Gmail Support: I am already using Gmail with Mozilla and would like to confirm that this setup will continue to be supported.

2. Custom Domain Support: I am in the process of setting up a private domain and am considering using hover.com or fastmail.com as my email provider. Can Mozilla support email accounts from these providers alongside Gmail?

3. Multi-Account Management: Is it possible to manage both Gmail and a custom domain email account within the same Mozilla client? If so, are there any limitations or special configurations that I should be aware of?

Your guidance on these matters would be greatly appreciated as I look to optimize my email management setup.

Thank you for your time and assistance. I look forward to your prompt response.

Best regards, David
creator: dsabine

title: 115.3.1 (64-bit) on Win10 taking over a minute to start up
content:
115.3.1 (64-bit) on Win10 Taking over a minute to start up. NOT Add-On related. I have also booted Windows in Safe Mode and it took even longer. I often wish to refer to my email saves and this Delay is most tedious to say the least.

Would it be possible for me to Roll Back to the previous v115 ?

Uncertain as to the version ‘points’ of my previous install, but I keep up with most updates, so it would have been August’s version most likely.

Sorry for any typos; my aim has been dodgy since my last eye op.
creator: Kozmyk

title: Hyperlinks do not work in Thunderbird
content:
App: Thunderbird Version: 115.3.0 FRESH INSTALL

OS: `$ cat /etc/os-release` NAME="Rocky Linux" VERSION="9.2 (Blue Onyx)" ID="rocky" ID_LIKE="rhel centos fedora" VERSION_ID="9.2" PLATFORM_ID="platform:el9" PRETTY_NAME="Rocky Linux 9.2 (Blue Onyx)" ANSI_COLOR="0;32" LOGO="fedora-logo-icon" CPE_NAME="cpe:/o:rocky:rocky:9::baseos" HOME_URL="https://rockylinux.org/" BUG_REPORT_URL="https://bugs.rockylinux.org/" SUPPORT_END="2032-05-31" ROCKY_SUPPORT_PRODUCT="Rocky-Linux-9" ROCKY_SUPPORT_PRODUCT_VERSION="9.2" REDHAT_SUPPORT_PRODUCT="Rocky Linux" REDHAT_SUPPORT_PRODUCT_VERSION="9.2"

Installed via Linux-native "Software" app that installed it via Flathub/flatpak.

I have no add-ons/extensions/whatnot.

Everything else but link opening works.

I have read and worked through the Hyperlinks in Messages Not Working article. I tried default app for "Web" both "Firefox" and "Vivaldi". None work.

There are no "content" settings that would clash on "HTTP / HTTPS content type".
creator: sebastijan.salak

title: Can't add GMX account
content: I cannot add my GMX account. I have been told by many people to enter different settings and things, and nothing works.
creator: LaughingMan008

title: Title pop up "balloon" (?)
content:
Minor issue.

TB 115.2.3 (64-bit) Supernova, Windows 10.

Don't know what it is called, the "text balloon" that sometimes pops up when you hover (when enabled I guess) over something.

In this case it is the "Subject" field in emails when viewing any folder.

Just noticed that if I am viewing the emails in a folder and have the cursor over the "Subject" line of a particular email, such that the "balloon" has popped up and is visible, if I press the "DELETE" key, the message will be deleted but the balloon does not change, but retains the previous "Subject" line text.

A minor issue, to be sure, but, I guess it is a bug. I did sign up for a Bugzilla account, but, not keen on disclosing some of the information gathered. Just as soon leave the bug reporting to someone else, if they can duplicate the problem, or care.

Thanks.
creator: joea-too

title: ThunderBird consuming over 100G of memory after computer enters sleep mode with the software open
content:
I recently noticed an issue after waking my MAC Book M1 (2020) from several days of sleep. Upon opening the lid, I was met with a system warning about low memory. Further investigation revealed that ThunderBird was using over 100G of memory.

Just a few days ago, I had updated my MAC to Sonoma 14.0, and last week ThunderBird was updated to version 115.3.0. Both were significant version upgrades, and I'm unsure where the problem lies.

I haven't installed any additional extensions or plugins, as shown in the attached screenshot. However, I did notice some components listed in the debug information, and I'm not sure why there's an inconsistency.

I will continue to monitor this issue to see if it reoccurs. For now, I'm just reporting this as a single instance along with my system information, hoping it's an isolated case.

title: thunderbird attachments problem
content:
Hi,

I hope you are doing well. I tried posting this topic yesterday, but for some reason I don't think it has been posted. I'm having an issue with thunderbird attachments, that is, saving them. But before I describe my issue, please give keyboard only solutions as I'm completely blind. I tried to contact the thunderbird groups io but I still don't have posting permissions. Anyway back to the issue. So I open the sent message. I press the toggal button, which shows the list of attachments. Rather than wanting to click save as or save all attachments, I want to copy the attachments that somebody has sent me. The problem is, while it coppies the last attachment with control c, I can't copy the first one, even though when I reach the top jaws and NVDA speak the first file. Is there an addon to fix this problem? If so, please let me know.

Best regards, Muhammad.
creator: muhammed3198

title: Contents of inbox partially lost.
content: On 27 September I was prompted to send an error report to Mozilla, which I did. When I checked my email, I found that the contents of my inbox had disappeared - there was only a blank space. Later I found that the missing mail was only for this year - mail from 31 Dec 2022 and before then is still there. And new emails arriving since then are displayed normally. Any idea what has happened? And is it possible to get the missing emails restored? Thank you. Nick Terdre
creator: nickterdre

title: Change in home page
content: Hi I am using Thunderbird & Edge. For years I have had notification of new unread emails under Inbox, I have clicked on Inbox and opened them. No Problem A couple of weeks ago this changed, after I believe an update. Now I still get the notification of new emails (& number of) in Inbox but could not access them. I discovered that now I have to click on the line above (which is my email address) which takes me to another page where I have to click on Read Messages which takes me back to Inbox! Why all this palaver. Please do not reply using jargon as I won't understand it. Gavin
creator: gavinmcardle706

title: User Manual/Documentation
content: Doing a search for 'Thunderbird User Manual' gets some 400+ hits, only one of which involves documentation. That one hit, a request for purchasing help for a bound user manual, has a response that "Being a free product, there is no nicely-written, bound, reference manual...We're very proud of what we do and of the documentation available." Linux, another free product, is documented in numerous "nicely-written, bound, reference manual[s]", as are most free software products. The string-search approach used here for help sometimes does not work well, and can often yield incorrect answers applying to other/older versions of the software. I am surprised at the response from a 'Top 10 Contributor' and not at all clear on the reason for the vehemence of the response. Browsers and email clients would seem to be the applications most likely to be used by the naive user, whom I would think we should encourage to seek and use documentation. As a software engineer, I certainly understand the preference for writing code over writing documentation, but also recognize the importance of well-maintained documentation. Is there something I am missing here? To my mind, the absence of coherent, date/version specific documentation is perhaps the greatest weakness in this product.
creator: dumpsterdan
